item.title: 2020-02-11: Epidemic Mitigation Time Forecast (2019-nCoV)
item.description: Time trends and model predictions of confirmed cases across the country Our model shows that the national epidemic situation will ease on 02-23 (the number of confirmed cases will not increase significantly). On 2020-2020-02-11 there will be 1760 new confirmed cases and in total 44004 confirmed cases. National Epidemic Time Series Date Confirmed Suspected Severe Dead Cured Conf.+Susp. Incr.

item.title: 2019-nCoV Epidemic Data Download
item.description: We collect several ways to get the 2019-nCoV epidemic data. Use the R ncovr package R users can get the epidemic data via the ncovr package we develop, which basically includes the datasets described later. # Install the remotes package install.packages('remotes') # Install the ncovr package remotes::install_github('pzhaonet/ncovr') # windows users have to set the Chinese environment Sys.setlocale('LC_CTYPE', 'Chinese') # Load the ncovr package require("ncovr") # read RDS data (default；recommended) get_ncov() # read .

item.title: About
item.description: This is the website for information of 2019-nCoV outbreak. In the news XJTLU: Model predicts date for near-end of new, confirmed 2019-nCoV cases in China: “To my knowledge, this is the only such open-access data website for novel coronavirus data that exists in the world,” said Johannes Knops, head of the Department of Health and Environmental Sciences at XJTLU. WeChat official account Project Homepage If you have any suggestions for this project, please feel free to submit an issue to the project homepage:

item.title: Overview of 2019-nCoV
item.description: Introduction of the virus Virus Type: New Coronavirus 2019-nCoV Source of infection: patients who are already with new coronavirus infection. Asymptomatic patients can also be contagious. Ways of Transmission: Respiratory droplets and contact transmission are the main ways of transmission. Other transmission ways such as aerosol and digestive tract are yet to be confirmed. Vulnerable population: Generally susceptible to all population. Elderly people and those with chronic diseases are more sick after infection.
